page.title: 16TRANSPORT IN ULLAPOOL.
page.content: In Ullapool there is no airport or railway station but at the Mercury Motor Inn there is a helicopter pad which is used occasionally. Ullapool is the terminal for the Stornoway ferry.Apart from thousands of tourists each year,it also carries heavy-goods lorries,cars,caravans, other vehicles,supplies and livestock for the Outer Hebrides.It operates daily,except Sundays,taking 3 to 3 1/2 hours to cross The Minch and is seldom stormbound. A'ferry' bus service is linked to the ferry timetable so that passengers have a direct journey to Inverness via Dingwall.Bus services link Ullapool with larger cities as far as London.A local bus runs 3 times a week,to Inverness and one from Lochinver to Ullapool carries senior pupils and passengers. Most families own cars.
